intro: Allosorus tamburii, commonly known as the Tamburii lichen, is a foliose lichen that thrives in humid, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Teloschistaceae and is characterized by its greenish-yellow to reddish-brown thallus. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a photosynthetic partner, typically a green alga, and a fungal component. It is often found on tree trunks and rocks in temperate regions. Due to its slow growth and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator of environmental health.
